utterance.speaker: MARINE 1
utterance.content: Take it Sarge, take it.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Oh I'll take it! Baby babe I'll meet you, same place, same time. Where we can, get together, and ease up, our mind. Do a little dance, make a... Yo yo, turn that back on, turn it back on.

utterance.speaker: MARINE 1
utterance.content: Don't look at me cause you know I didn't do it all right? Don't look at me.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Hey, you better have put fresh batteries in that like I told you to.

utterance.speaker: MARINE 1
utterance.content: I did Sarge, all right? The ones you gave me, I did, I put them in.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Well then hit it or something. Otherwise, you're all going to have to listen to me sing! Son of a bitch!

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Here. Don't panic, and don't shoot us, don't die. Got it G?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Up and at em, you're supposed to be in clinic duty.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah, like I could sleep down there with all the crying and coughing.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Here. Ex-Marine. Thinks he has gulf war syndrome.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There's no such thing.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: So he's been told, it hasn't stopped the unexplained fatigue, rashes and joint pain. And just so you know, he's the nephew of a benefactor I owe a favour, so you're going to take this case whether you like it or not.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why wouldn't I want to take the case? The guy's tired and sore, it's going to be chapter one in my...

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Don't panic, and don't shoot us, don't die.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You know him?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Never met him before in my life.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Ok...Well you're about to. He's on his way here. Get your ass up and get your team together. You've got work to do.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: That's amazing.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No it's not.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: It's not?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I can play the harmonica with my nose, make a penny come out of a child's ear, or any other orifice for that matter; under the right circumstances I could bring two women into simultaneous ecstasy.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: The right circumstance being their agreement to bill you on the same credit card.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What I absolutely cannot do is dream about someone I've never seen before.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Just because you don't understand it doesn't mean it can't happen.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: True, it can't happen because it can't happen!

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Well maybe you didn't dream about this guy specifically.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Right, just some other guy who looks exactly like him.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No, you imagined some generic Marine then you placed his face in the dream after you saw the picture. Sort of a coincidence mixed with a little déjà vu.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There's no record of him ever coming into the clinic so I must have seen him before somewhere else.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Fine, you've known him since cub scouts. The more interesting question isn't what you dreamed but why? I'm guessing you're longing for either a renewed relationship with your dad or a new relationship with one of the Village People.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He was in the Navy not the Marines.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I thought your dad was in the Marines?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The guy in the Village People.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Actually he's only in the Navy when they sang, In The Navy. The rest of the time he's just in generic fatigues. What? You brought it up! You didn't flush.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I didn't pee.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Male, 34, just got out of the Marines after 2 years in Iraq. Admitted complaining of chronic fatigue, joint pains, intermittent rashes and sore throats. Thinks he has gulf war syndrome.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Why is he here instead of the VA?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because he has a rich uncle that Cuddy is trying to avoid fellating and doesn't buy the VA's diagnosis of Nothing's-wrong-atosis.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: The VA is right, there's no such thing as Gulf War Syndrome especially in veterans who've never served in the Gulf War.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Different war, same place. Whatever was there in 1990 is still there.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: That can send you home in a pine box but it still can't get you sick 3 months after you've gotten home.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What, so thousands of soldiers are lying about the symptoms?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You send 700,000 people on a vacation to Hawaii some of them are going to come back sick, doesn't mean it was caused by snorkelling.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He's right. Studies all show the same pattern of symptoms in veterans that were sent to the Gulf and those who weren't.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: That's it? You believe her but not me?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Stick to your guns Chase. Just because there isn't a single unifying symptom doesn't mean there isn't something going on. Could just affect everyone differently.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You think this guy has Gulf War Syndrome?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Course not. He's depressed and he's looking for a disability check. Most likely because he's just realised that knowing how to barter for sex in six languages and open a beer bottle with your eye socket are not the most marketable skills.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Why'd you take this case?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because a good scientist continually questions his own theories and assumptions.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Cuddy's making him.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Now I'm making you. Do a full physical and recheck his blood for HIV, Hep C, Malaria, Schistosomiasis and T strain A. baumannii just to make sure the VA's dotted their i's and find out every hospital and clinic he's ever visited, every city he's ever lived in and... whether he's ever been on TV.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: TV?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The problem could be neurological, everyone knows TV rots your brain.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: It's usually the worst on my palms and the bottoms of my feet. I get these, black dots all over.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I don't see anything.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: It comes and goes.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You sure it's not just scrapes and bruises?

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: I know the difference between a rash and a bruise.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Sometimes it's harder than you realise to distinguish between the two. You obviously exercise.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: My problems aren't caused by my workouts.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: But you do work out, and by the look of you pretty strenuously. That's not usually the case with patients whose principal complaint is chronic fatigue and joint pain.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: I was in the Marines for 12 years. I'm used to doing PT every day. Just because I can push through the pain doesn't mean it's not there.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We're not saying we don't believe you.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: The hell you aren't.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We just need to be specific about what exactly the problems are.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: I sleep 10 hours at night, but I feel tired all the time. I constantly get coughs, rashes, sore throats. My knees and hips feel like someone poured sand in my joints. I get these weird tingling sensations in my legs, sometimes they're cold, other times it feels like my blood is boiling. Specific enough? Look I don't care what you guys call it, Gulf War Syndrome, Iraq fever or just crappy sickness X. I just want someone to figure out what it is so they can cure it.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Except for the supposed pain in his joints none of the other symptoms he's complaining about are currently evident.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Besides low potassium, probably caused by him overhydrating after working out. His blood work's all normal.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Low potassium could also probably be caused by the experimental vaccines and anti chemical warfare pills he was given before he deployed to Iraq. Not to mention the fact that whole country is littered with hundreds of tons of radioactive shrapnel from depleted uranium munitions.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What did you go to medical school in France? There's no trace of uranium in his urine. He was given the vaccines and meds 2 years ago without any allergic or adverse reactions.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Has he ever done any modelling?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We forgot to ask. We should send his urine to the University of Leicester there's a professor there who's developed a more advanced screening technique for uranium.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: If the levels are too low for us to detect they're way too low to cause any damage. Where you going?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: This way. Did you find out about any television or other media exposure?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Do you really care or are you just trying to waste hospital resources to get back at Cuddy for making you take the case?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Of course I care, what a horrible thing to say. Do a Lexis-Nexis search and get a copy of his credit report.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Before or after we tell him to eat a banana and discharge him with a psych referral?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I say before. And I say in between give him a polysomnogram. Sleep apnea could cause chronic fatigue and paranoia. Find out where he went to summer camp.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Are you ok?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yea just a little too much coffee this morning.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Were we... walking you to the bathroom?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I wish. Wilson was just in there. These guys know what I'm talking about.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: That's his third REM cycle and his breathing is completely normal, there's obviously nothing wrong with his sleep pattern.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: It's not uranium it's got to be some other sort of toxin.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Or nothing at all. Do you really think there's something wrong, or do you just want Foreman to be wrong?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Both.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Well, it's not his sleep pattern. If you really think it's a toxin you can do a liver biopsy in the morning.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We can't leave, if we don't monitor the whole test House won't accept the results, he'll just make us do it over.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It doesn't take two doctors to monitor what's clearly going to be a normal polysomnogram.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Oh so you want me to stay?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You're the one that thought there was something wrong.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I never said it was a sleep disorder.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You want to flip for it?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Just... go.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Oh c'mon, don't be a baby. Fine, I'll stay. You know what we could do...

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Here?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Why not? We're surrounded by empty rooms with beds in them.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yea and video cameras too.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: So we turn them off.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yeah that's all I need is House or Foreman walking in on us.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: We have the keys.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No, what if he wakes up?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Alright. Suit yourself.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Damn it.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Hello? Is anybody out there? I think there's a problem in here.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: What do you mean what's wrong? You don't smell that?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Nothing smells John.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? It's disgusting!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: How long have you thought... Wait. Open your mouth The smell's not in the room, it's in your mouth.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Good question.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You were wrong about the nothing's-wrong-atosis, you can fake fatigue and joint pain but you can't fake bacterial vaginosis in your mouth.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Where's his mouth been?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Says he hasn't performed oral sex on anyone for over a year.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Selfish bastard.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Because he hasn't been with anyone since his last girlfriend dumped him after he deployed to Iraq the second time.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Selfish bitch.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We've ruled out HIV, diabetes and any other endocrine abnormality.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Could be autoimmune, Sjogren's decreases salivary flow creates a hospitable home for bacteria.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No, his eyes and tear ducts are fine.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Who was his last girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yea we'll get right on that. Chronic fatigue, joint pain and opportunistic infection spells cancer, probably lymphoma. We should biopsy his tonsillar and submandibular lymph nodes

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Right about cancer, wrong about lymphoma. Unless you're simply hiding the fact that his lymph nodes are swollen. Get Wilson to biopsy his salivary glands. He's got parotid cancer, and see if you can get to the truth about who he's been dating, there's no way a Marine goes a year without getting some blood on his bayonet.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: It's not an STD you just said...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just do it.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: The antibiotics should at least relieve the infection, which will reduce the odour and taste in your mouth.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Not soon enough.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: All right, you're going to feel a little burn.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: You know I never even dipped. Chewing tobacco. Practically everyone in my unit did, but me. I was so paranoid about cancer.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Well if it's parotid cancer it's very treatable if diagnosed early.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: My mom had cancer, which is why I know that diagnosing cancer early means before there's any serious symptoms. Certainly tastes like a pretty serious symptom you know?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: We'll know more after the test.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: If he was just trying to mess with Cuddy for wasting his time this would have stopped as soon as the patient started exhibiting actual symptoms.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: So the question is why is he wasting our time?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Or is he wasting our time?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You think he's got a medical reason for asking for the guy's credit report?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I don't. Where were you two when the guy woke up?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Uhhh... we just... stepped out for a second.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: To do what?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: To... get a coffee. We'd been up most of the night.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He's just pushing to make sure we get the complete history, obviously we're missing something or we'd have the answer.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You didn't have any coffee when you came back.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: All right already, we confess. You caught us, we snuck into one of the sleep lab rooms to have sex, we shouldn't have done it while we were supposed to be working and we're sorry, now can we move on?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: House would do Wilson before you'd do Chase.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: No you would do House AND Wilson before I do Chase. Now can we get back to work?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: She did me once!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: She was stoned!

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Biopsy's inconclusive. I'm going to do a sialogram while we wait for the results from the additional blood work.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No hurry. Probably nothing we can do at this point anyway.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Well if the cancer hasn't spread.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's spitting stink. You should focus on the living. I need a prescription.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I just wrote you a prescription.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: For Vicodin, I need alfuzosin.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No you don't. You figured out where you met your Marine?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What? Oh that, I haven't really thought about it. I can't pee.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You can't remember him can you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I can't pee.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: So stop taking the Vicodin.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I want to pee and not be in pain.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Why don't you go to sleep?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't pee when I'm asleep.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Maybe you'll dream about him again and maybe he'll give you an address.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I haven't peed in three days.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I read that REM sleep is the brain's way of working out problems.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Very useful, did you hear what I just said?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Yea you lied because you want to avoid talking about your obsession.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not obsessing.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Why don't you just ask him?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I haven't peed in three days!

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You'd be dead.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not counting intermittent drips.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You'd be in agony.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I passed agony yesterday around 4.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: His mother, brother, uncle and best friend all confirm he hasn't had a date in over a year, which means it's not an STD. If you come up with something medically relevant, page me.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: What did you want me to tell him? The truth?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No. You didn't have to be so convincing.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Don't worry. I'll make it up to you.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: This is getting out of control.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Don't pout.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Our patient woke up with an infection while we were getting our rocks off.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Do you want to stop?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No. But I don't want to get caught either.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You think I do?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You certainly didn't go out of your way to keep the volume down while we were in the sleep lab.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I couldn't help that... Why would I want to get caught?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Maybe you want to give House a reason to be jealous?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I'm over House. All this is, is uncomplicated sex, don't try to make it more than that.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We're not doing it at work anymore.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Fine. Want to go grab some lunch?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: I think the pill is the way to go, we haven't had a condom break yet thank god, but it's bound to happen. Especially the way we've been doing it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: On a bed of nails?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: No he's not kinky. He's just insatiable. I can barely make it to any of my morning classes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You smoke?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: No way.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Stop it!

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Any history of hypertension? Blood clots? Strokes?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Nope. Besides my OCD I'm fit as a fiddle.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You have OCD.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Duh. Can't you tell?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Any other compulsions besides drinking massive amounts of water?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: No. That's it thank god. My therapist says it could be a lot worse.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You get up in the middle of the night to drink?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Yeah, every couple of hours.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Then your therapist is an idiot. Unconscious people don't have OCD. They can however have diabetes insipidus.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: That's impossible. I eat candy all the time.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Different kind of diabetes. This kind is cause by a banged up pituitary. You're obviously more of a lover than a fighter I'm guessing either a car accident or... you cracked your skull on the balance beam.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: How'd you know?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Easy, nice ass, no boobs, you got palms like a longshoreman. Wait here, you need a CAT scan.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Oh my god.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Don't worry, just means you'll be taking two hormone supplements instead of one.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Ok, this time you're going to feel a little pressure, I'm inserting the contrast material.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Could you turn up the music?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Sure. Looks pretty good so far.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Still can't hear it that well.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Can you hear it now? John? John? John can you hear me?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Still no... relief?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I got relief. I just got no pee.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: If the pills didn't work you may need a catheter.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You didn't come here to talk to me about my pee, what's going on?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: He's got cancer all right, but it's not in his salivary glands, it's in his brain. And it's bad, at least 6 tumours, maybe more. He lost his hearing, his sight's probably next.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Death is probably next.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No way he could've grown all these in a week.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Any older, VA couldn't have missed all these.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Maybe they didn't miss them, just mixed them up. Switched his films with another patient's by mistake.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Maybe, but it means some poor sap's getting his melon sliced in the VA for no reason.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: This poor sergeant is going to be dead by the end of the week.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Where have you two been?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Lunch. Why, what happened?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wilson's found some fast growing, illusive, or magic brain tumours. What did you find?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Nothing, he's telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: About everything. Where he's lived, who he's dated, besides forgetting to mention his dad's shin splints, his granddad's nosebleeds and to return a few rented DVD's, everything he's told us has checked out.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You have them researching your dream?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nope. I have them researching my patient.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You had a dream about a patient?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: This poor guy's brain is riddled with tumours and you're checking his credit report? C'mon, I need you guys.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Where you going?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: To do my job.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's not your patient.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: He is now. Go home and go to sleep, maybe you'll dream the cure to late stage brain cancer.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: How is he?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's dead.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Oh god.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Least he will be in a few days. Question is why? The only explanation is that the VA hospital screwed up.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: There was definitely no mix up I had them recheck.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes, why would a government agency lie to cover up a mistake? Might've caused the death of a guy they've been trying to kill for the last two years anyway.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: They didn't lie Did you just take two Vicodin?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, it was an antidepressant, I was told to take two every time you walked into the room.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: The VA scan of his brain. No tumours.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes this has proved positive that someone didn't have tumours in his brain.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You see that bright spot below his left orbit. That is the titanium pin your patient had inserted 20 years ago. Unless you think the VA happened to mix up his scans with someone who had the exact same pin, they didn't screw up.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You paged us?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why didn't you send his urine to Leicester like I told you?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Because you told me not to.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why did you choose that moment to listen to me?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You think depleted uranium might have something to do with his tumours?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Radiation's the only thing that will make tumours grow that fast.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: High doses of radiation. Even if he ate depleted uranium bullets for breakfast he still would have been exposed to less radiation than we've given him in the last two days.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Do it anyway. And you, call his uncle back, find out if he ever brought his nephew to any hospital parties or fundraisers.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: No. Not until you give me a reason.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because... I'm your boss.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: A rational reason. Or at least admit that you don't have one.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I've got a full bladder and I'm not afraid to use it.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: But you are apparently afraid of discovering something that you can't rationally explain...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: SHUT UP! Do what you're told. Cuddy and Wilson may not have to listen to me but you do.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: What the hell was that all about?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I don't care. Which is why I didn't feel the need to ask him 8 personal questions.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I'm over him.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Just making an observation.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: All right, ready whenever you are.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'm ready. Wait a minute. Zoom in. I don't see it. You sure you got the right coordinates?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Yea she's in the right place. Go 10 millimetres above the ACPC line on the Z-axis.

utterance.speaker: NURSE
utterance.content: 10 mil above ACPC on Z.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's not there anymore.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Are you sure you got the gantry angle right?

utterance.speaker: NURSE
utterance.content: Yeah I'm sure.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's not there.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It disappeared.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: 6 tumours don't just disappear.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Unless they were never there to begin with.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: The VA didn't screw up.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Maybe someone else did. Maybe it was Dr. Self-Righteous.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I saw the tumours. There was no mix up.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Maybe there's something wrong with the portable imager in the OR.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Something that would cause it to show brain tissue in perfect detail but completely miss neoplastic tissue?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Then they were never tumours to begin with.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I told you I saw...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No you saw something that looked like tumours. We all did. We were all wrong. Well maybe he doesn't have cancer maybe he has a brain infection that's causing multiple abscesses.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: That miraculously healed?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, they were healed by the antibiotics we're giving him for the vaginosis in his mouth.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: If it's an infection why didn't it show up in his blood work?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't know. Yet.

utterance.speaker: NURSE
utterance.content: Dr. Wilson, we have a problem.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: What did you do? I can't feel my legs. I can't feel my legs! What did you guys do?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: John, John, calm down. We didn't even operate. Would this be a usual effect?

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: I can't feel my legs!

utterance.speaker: NURSE
utterance.content: It's not the anaesthesia.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: John, John! We're going to figure out what's wrong with you, but first we need to know one thing. Have you ever appeared in any pornos?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Chronic fatigue, sore throats, rashes, putrid discharge of the mouth, multiple abscesses in the brain, hearing loss and last but not least lower limb paralysis. He's certainly given us plenty of clues.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It's got to be some sort of infection.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That's miraculously improving in his brain but getting worse in his ears and legs?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Could be an infection and cancer. Neoplastic syndrome could depress his immune system and cause the other symptoms.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. You're basing this theory on the negative biopsy, the lymph nodes that aren't swollen or the tumours that were never there to begin with?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: And what are you going to base your theory on? His favourite restaurants?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I was right. He's excreting depleted uranium in his urine. We should start him on an IV infusion of isotonic sodium bicarbonates.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's not depleted uranium.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You're the one...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Who asked for the test when we were thinking cancer, we no longer are.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Depleted uranium doesn't just cause cells to mutate it can cause cell death as well.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not spinal cord cells. At least not until the dose is high enough to kill all his other cells first.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: So you're saying the radioactive uranium in his urine is irrelevant?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The sun is radioactive, the earth is radioactive, this hospital is filled with radiation. The issue is not where it is but how much there is, and what damage that amount could cause inside someone's spinal cord, as I've already stated quite clearly...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Got it, we're all idiots, what's your theory?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Give me your keys.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You ever tried riding a motorcycle with a distended bladder? Keep him on antibiotics, check his hearing and paralysis every hour.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: So you basically want us to do nothing?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No... I basically want to do nothing. I want you to keep him on antibiotics and check his hearing and paralysis every hour.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Wait, you can't go home now.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Actually I have to go home now. It's two days past my bedtime.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: House he needs your help.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And I need sleep. Hey it's the brain's way of working out problems that the conscious mind can't solve during the day remember?

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: No, nothing. I'm going to die, aren't I?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No, we're not. We should start treatment for the uranium toxicity like you said.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: But House...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Isn't here.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: If House wanted to be involved in the case...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: If he wanted us to start this treatment he would have told us to the last time you brought it up.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You have a better idea?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Then we're going with Chase's.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Tell him not to get the lines tangled. The infusion is slow we can't have any kinks in the lines.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I went to medical school too.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Keep your arms on your body, above your heart.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: I can't feel my stomach. I don't feel that. I don't feel anything.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: The paralysis is ascending, if it keeps going we're going to need a respirator.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: What? What are you saying?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Can you breathe?

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: No. Not yet.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So, where were we?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You have a nice night?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: The paralysis is ascending. Last check it was nearly to his diaphragm.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Tells us something.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Means it's getting worse.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Worse is something.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Actually it tells us it's not the uranium.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Did we think it was?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We started him on sodium bicarb to try and flush the uranium out of his system.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Great, now the fact that he's getting worse tells us nothing. Never thought it was uranium. For all we know uranium treatment is what's making him...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Sodium bicarb infusion wouldn't have any effect on...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: On what? Kind of hard to say what it would have an effect on if you have no idea what's there to affect.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We had to do something.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well next time, go with something that has a chance of working.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Like what? Did you come up with some brilliant idea while you were warm and cosy in your bed at home?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We need more information.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: How much more information could you possible want? We have a medical history going all the way back to his great grandparents. A non-medical history going...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's not enough.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: It's all we're going to get.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Want to bet?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Who approved a sodium bicarb infusion?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Don't look at me, I was home in bed.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: He's unconscious, his skin has lost all colour and his BP and hematocrit are plunging.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He was only on the sodium bicarb...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's bleeding out.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He can't be bleeding out there's no blood in the bed.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Fine, he's bleeding in.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: There's no sign of bruising or internal haemorrhaging.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: The paralysis must have reached his diaphragm he's not able to oxygenate his blood.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's not able to oxygenate his blood because he doesn't have any left.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: There's no evidence...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The only thing that would explain...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: There's no reason for blood loss.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There has to be a reason, he needs a transfusion. Get me four units of O negative stat! Now let's elevate his feet.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: He doesn't need a transfusion.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nobody asked you. In fact why are you even here?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Because obviously you need my help.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Get out.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: House. His blood obviously didn't just vanish... What the hell is this?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Somebody must have spilled something. Somebody else should be getting me four units of O negative stat.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What the hell is that?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's a urine catheter collection bag with a rip in it, what hell's it look like?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What? It's just urine. It's sterile. No one's getting me blood! Why isn't anybody getting me blood?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You're bleeding.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: House are you all right?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why are you even here?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I'm always here.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No you're not. There got to be a reason. There has to be.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So, where were we?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You have a nice night?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes I did thank you. I'm guessing better than our patient. Probably due to his BP and hematocrit plunging.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: How'd you know?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The answer was staring right at us the whole time, as plain as the nose on our faces, or the nose on his face.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: What's going on, what'd he say?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No hairs and cauterisation scars.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Which means?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He had it cauterised.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: How could you know that?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because it makes sense, undoubtedly done to stop the same childhood nosebleeds that plagued his grandfather, undoubtedly because they were both born with Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: What's he saying?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm saying you got a genetic disease that is destroying your capillaries.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: That no one in his family has ever been diagnosed with before?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not surprising, since the most common initial symptoms, skin rashes and nosebleeds, are often written off as the result of minor trauma or dry weather. But they can also be the result of his arteries and veins merging together. He obviously has AVM's. An AVM near his spine caused the paralysis. AVM in his lungs prevented his blood from being filtered. Dirty blood caused the joint pain, fatigue and the infections in his mouth and brain. Nothing that a few surgeries won't clear up. Get MR angiograms of the aforementioned. The Marines weren't hiding anything, he was, or at least he forgot to mention his bloody tissue issue.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: What's going on, what'd he say?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Oh, looks like solving the case, solved your other problem.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There is no medicine like happiness, except maybe laughter, or rubber tubes shoved up your urethra.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You cathed yourself?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's actually not that bad after the first... I don't know, 9 or 10 inches. Cath relieved the spasm. I'm as good as new.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Of course, just a minor spasm in a muscle you've been using multiple times a day without any problem for the past 45 years. Not a major side effect caused by the overuse of a particular narcotic painkiller.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah that was my thought too.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: So, no reason to think about cutting back on your use of that particular pill.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Thank god. Actually it was a triple dose of the good stuff that allowed me to finally get some sleep and solve the case. The pills made all my dreams come true.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You really got the answer in your sleep?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I got one in my sleep, the other one I got in the shower.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I've been thinking about you. You lied.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I didn't lie, I simply chose not to share completely irrelevant facts.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Like the fact that you lied. No wonder I couldn't place his face. You were practically swallowing it on the dance floor.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I was not.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Talk about the cool uncle, he donates the money while the nephew gets the write off. Of course by write off I mean he gets to put your ankles...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: This is exactly why I didn't mention our one date over two years ago.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because of my t-shirt?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Because you are an obnoxious ass. Because you would've spent the whole time...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That's very smart, because this way I spent my whole time completely focused on the patient.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: How did you even remember him? We were only at that party for like 10 minutes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What is this some new health plan? You service the Dean of Medicine and you get free health care for a year? Why are you smiling?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You remembered him because he made out with me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm good with faces. So this plan, is it open to anyone? Is there a co-pay?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You're lousy with faces.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Don't make this about me, this is your humiliation. So how much for private room coverage?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Get over me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh give me a break. You hired me...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Because you're a good doctor who couldn't get himself hired at a blood bank so I got you cheap.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You gave me everything I asked for because one night I gave you everything you...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Stop staring at my ass when you think I'm not looking, showing up at restaurants where I happen to be on a date and fantasising about me in the shower. That ship sailed long ago House. Get over it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If you're still referring to you ass I think that super tanker sailed would be a more precise metaphor.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sorry, looking for an extra large trash can.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Since when does he clean anything up?
